revised_title: Coastally Trapped Waves, Baroclinic Eddies, and Oceanic Fronts at the Shelf Break
tldr: This article discusses the physical variability and exchanges between shelf and oceanic waters at the continental shelf break. It explores coastally trapped waves, baroclinic eddies, internal tides, and oceanic fronts, which are all influenced by atmospheric forcing and topographic features like submarine capes and canyons.
